faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to common questions about our platform

q1.question: What is tournamente.com?
q1.answer: tournamente.com is a comprehensive platform for managing tournaments, clubs, and teams. It allows organizers to schedule matches, manage registrations, track standings, and communicate with participants.

q2.question: Do I need to create an account?
q2.answer: Yes, you need to create an account to use the platform. Registration is free and takes just a few minutes. You can sign up as a tournament organizer, club manager, or team participant.

q3.question: How do I sign up?
q3.answer: Click the "Sign Up" button on the homepage, provide your email address, create a password, and fill in your profile information. You can start using the platform immediately after registration.

q4.question: Is there a mobile app?
q4.answer: Our platform is fully responsive and works great on mobile devices. We're also developing native iOS and Android apps that will be available soon.

q1.question: How do I create a tournament?
q1.answer: Log in to your account, navigate to "Create Tournament", fill in the tournament details (name, date, location, format), and click "Create". You can then add categories, teams, and schedule matches.

q2.question: What tournament formats are supported?
q2.answer: We support multiple formats including group stage, knockout, round-robin, and hybrid formats. You can customize the format based on your needs.

q3.question: Can I edit a tournament after creating it?
q3.answer: Yes, you can edit most tournament details. However, some settings may be locked once matches have started to maintain data integrity.

q4.question: How do I publish my tournament?
q4.answer: After creating your tournament, you can publish it to make it visible to other users. They can then register their teams to participate.

q5.question: Can I duplicate a tournament?
q5.answer: Yes, you can duplicate an existing tournament to quickly create similar ones. The new tournament will have the same structure but separate data.

q1.question: How do I create a club?
q1.answer: Go to your dashboard, click "Create Club", enter the club name, add basic information, and save. You can then add teams and members to your club.

q2.question: How many teams can a club have?
q2.answer: The number of teams depends on your subscription plan. Basic plans allow unlimited teams, while Professional and Enterprise plans have additional features.

q3.question: How do I add members to my club?
q3.answer: In your club dashboard, go to Members, click "Add Member", and provide their email address. They'll receive an invitation to join your club.

q4.question: Can I manage team rosters?
q4.answer: Yes, you can add and remove players from your team roster. You can also assign positions, jersey numbers, and track player statistics.

q1.question: How do I create match schedules?
q1.answer: In your tournament dashboard, go to "Schedule", select the teams and date/time, and create matches. You can create them individually or use our scheduling algorithm.

q2.question: Can I automatically generate group stage matches?
q2.answer: Yes, our scheduling tool can automatically generate group stage matches, round-robin schedules, and knockout brackets based on your settings.

q3.question: How do I update match results?
q3.answer: After a match is played, open the match details and enter the final score. You can also add details like goal scorers and red/yellow cards.

q4.question: Can participants see the schedule?
q4.answer: Yes, published schedules are visible to all tournament participants. You can set specific visibility preferences for each match.

q1.question: How are standings calculated?
q1.answer: Standings are automatically calculated based on match results. Typically, 3 points for a win, 1 point for a draw, and 0 for a loss. You can customize point systems.

q2.question: How do I view team statistics?
q2.answer: Go to the tournament dashboard and select "Standings". You'll see points, wins, losses, draws, goals for/against, and other statistics.

q3.question: Can I export tournament data?
q3.answer: Yes, you can export standings, match results, and team information as CSV or PDF. This feature is available in Professional and Enterprise plans.

q4.question: Where can I find top scorers?
q4.answer: Go to the tournament statistics page and select "Top Scorers" to see the highest-scoring players ranked by number of goals.

q1.question: What payment methods do you accept?
q1.answer: We accept credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex), bank transfers, and PayPal.

q2.question: Can I cancel my subscription?
q2.answer: Yes, you can cancel anytime from your account settings. No long-term contracts are required.

q3.question: Is there a free trial?
q3.answer: Yes, Professional and Enterprise plans offer a 14-day free trial with full access to all features.

q4.question: Can I change my plan?
q4.answer: Yes, you can upgrade or downgrade your plan anytime. Changes take effect immediately and billing is adjusted accordingly.

q5.question: How do I reset my password?
q5.answer: Click "Forgot Password" on the login page, enter your email, and follow the instructions sent to your inbox.

commitment.title: Our Commitment to GDPR
commitment.description1: tournamente.com is committed to complying with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), which protects the personal data and privacy of individuals in the European Union (EU) and European Economic Area (EEA).
commitment.description2: This page provides information about how we comply with GDPR requirements and explains your rights under GDPR.

legalBasis.title: Legal Basis for Processing
legalBasis.description: We process your personal data under the following legal bases:

consent.title: Consent (Article 6(1)(a))
consent.description: You have given clear consent for us to process your personal data for specific purposes, such as marketing communications or location services.

contract.title: Contract (Article 6(1)(b))
contract.description: Processing is necessary to fulfill our contract with you when you use our tournament management services.

legalObligation.title: Legal Obligation (Article 6(1)(c))
legalObligation.description: Processing is necessary to comply with applicable laws and regulations.

legitimateInterests.title: Legitimate Interests (Article 6(1)(f))
legitimateInterests.description: Processing is necessary for our legitimate interests, such as fraud prevention, network security, and service improvement.

access.title: 1. Right to Access (Article 15)
access.description: You have the right to request copies of your personal data. We may charge a small fee for this service.

rectification.title: 2. Right to Rectification (Article 16)
rectification.description: You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate or complete information you believe is incomplete.

erasure.title: 3. Right to Erasure (Article 17)
erasure.description: You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.

restrict.title: 4. Right to Restrict Processing (Article 18)
restrict.description: You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

portability.title: 5. Right to Data Portability (Article 20)
portability.description: You have the right to request that we transfer the data we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.

object.title: 6. Right to Object (Article 21)
object.description: You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.

automated.title: 7. Rights Related to Automated Decision-Making (Article 22)
automated.description: You have the right not to be subject to a decision based solely on automated processing, including profiling.

dpo.title: Data Protection Officer
dpo.description: We have appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO) to oversee our GDPR compliance. You can contact our DPO for any questions or concerns regarding data protection:
dpo.subject: Subject Line

dataTransfers.title: International Data Transfers
dataTransfers.description: When we transfer personal data outside the EU/EEA, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place, including:
dataTransfers.safeguard1: Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs) approved by the European Commission
dataTransfers.safeguard2: Adequacy decisions for countries deemed to provide adequate protection
dataTransfers.safeguard3: Binding Corporate Rules for intra-group transfers

dataBreach.title: Data Breach Notification
dataBreach.description: In the event of a data breach that is likely to result in a risk to your rights and freedoms, we will notify you and the relevant supervisory authority within 72 hours of becoming aware of the breach, as required by GDPR Article 33 and 34.

consent.title: Consent Management
consent.description: We obtain your consent for processing personal data where required by GDPR. You can manage your consent preferences at any time. Below are the categories of data processing that require your consent:

essential.title: Essential Cookies (Required)
essential.description: These cookies are strictly necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are usually set in response to actions you take such as setting your privacy preferences, logging in, or filling in forms.
essential.examples: Examples: Session cookies, authentication tokens, security cookies

analytics.title: Analytics & Performance
analytics.description: We use analytics services to understand how visitors interact with our website. This helps us improve our services and user experience. These services collect anonymized data about page visits, time spent, and navigation patterns.
analytics.purposeDesc: Website traffic analysis, user behavior insights, search performance optimization

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.description: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization, such as remembering your language preference, location, and display settings. If you do not allow these cookies, some or all of these features may not function properly.

withdraw.title: Withdrawing Consent
withdraw.description: You can withdraw your consent at any time by adjusting your cookie preferences through our cookie banner, clearing your browser cookies, or contacting us at contact@tournamente.com. Withdrawing consent does not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

exercise.title: How to Exercise Your Rights
exercise.description: To exercise any of your GDPR rights, please:
exercise.step2: Include your full name, email address, and specific request
exercise.step3: Provide proof of identity (for security purposes)
exercise.step4: We will respond to your request within 30 days
exercise.complaint: If you are not satisfied with our response, you have the right to lodge a complaint with the Romanian National Supervisory Authority (ANSPDCP) or your local supervisory authority.

supervisory.title: Supervisory Authority
supervisory.description: You have the right to lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority. As a Romanian company, our lead supervisory authority is the Romanian National Supervisory Authority for Personal Data Processing (ANSPDCP). You may also contact the supervisory authority in your EU member state of habitual residence or place of work.
supervisory.link: For a list of supervisory authorities, please visit

updates.title: Updates to GDPR Compliance
updates.description: We regularly review and update our GDPR compliance practices to ensure we meet all regulatory requirements. Any significant changes will be communicated through our Privacy Policy updates.
